alert.note: Alert for Boyd (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 24 at 9:59AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Nebraska, including the following county, Boyd. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 957 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms early this morning. This will cause small stream flooding, especially along the Ponca Creek and its tributaries. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Spencer, Butte, Lynch, Bristow and Anoka. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
